result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas J Maloney in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF389, 14CF161, and 15CF508. 14CF161 will remain in DPA status.  In 15CF508 Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 1 & 2. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Cts. 3 & 4 Dismissed and read in. Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days in jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence. $453.00 costs. Ct. 2 5 days jail, with Huber, consecutive to Ct. 1.  $253.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample. 15CF389 Dismissed and read in.
Return date on March 2, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Cases called: 15CF389, 15CF508 & 14CF161, Defendant Thomas J Maloney in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Burdon motioned to withdraw the Motion to revoke the DPA. Court granted motion. Cases to be set for pretrial and return.

Defendant Thomas J Maloney in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Klopp raises competency in another case, requesting new date, Arraignment set for 4/22/16 at 2:45 P.M. Br. 1

Klopp objected. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
